title: How to Make a Time Capsule (for Kids and Preteens)

steps.headline: Get a box that can fit all your items.
steps.description: If you plan on burying your box, make sure it's durable and can last a long time outdoors.

steps.headline: Find a large spot to bury the capsule.
Decorate the box if you are hiding it.
Put your name and date you buried/hide it on the box.
Write a letter to the finder of the time capsule or to yourself.
Get a few items that really reflect who you are.
steps.description:
Examples include:
Small Toys
Used Gift Cards

Photos and Postcards
A coin minted this year
Pictures of your favorite celebrities

Take-out menus

steps.headline: Bury or hide the time capsule.
steps.description: Make sure you have permission from your parents.

steps.headline: Try to forget about the box.
Wait for someone to discover it or you can open it up in 1-10 years.
